column4: I have integrated graphics on a new install of Jaunty dual booted with XP. Video is very choppy compared to in XP and the visual effects appearance editor won't let me set anything other than None. The vid is integrated, intel I think, but I don't know what I'm supposed to do to get it working
first check, if it's intel
in console: dmesg | grep -i intel
It says Intel 830M Chipset
sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-intel
try this first
it says it's ready the newest version
yep, also google for UXA and EXA in xorg.conf
also -- I'm having intel at laptop (x3100)
driver is really crappy :-(
some try to install custom stuff from ppas
be prepared -- as I said intel video is a nightmare now at linux :-(
i made a backup of xorg... if i can only use some kind of command line after i try this, will there be a simple command to restore it?
xorg.conf? it's simple -- just save -- mv -v /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.old, then, after restoring do vice versa
didn't work, and xorg is restored...
you played with exa?
I'm not sure, i don't know about this stuff... i just added Option AccelMethod “UXA”  under the device section
sounds like that...
and what are your symptoms? your affects are slow?
some parsing error or something i think
this EXA and UXA modes are pain in ass :) you should carefully google for them, search from which versions of *kernel* and *intel-drivers* some modes are supported and some not
